member.name: T:mjuAudio.Flac.Audio.BitStream
member.summary: Represents a read-only FileStream as a succession of bits.
member.remarks:
Provides a few methods to handle variable length encoded numbers.
Note: all numbers are supposed to be BigEndian (e.g., not Intel representation).

member.name: M:mjuAudio.Flac.Audio.BitStream.#ctor(System.String,System.Int64)
member.summary: Creates a bit stream from a given file, starting at a given position.
member.param: The path to the file.
The zero-based offset from the start of the file, where the bit stream should begin.

member.name: M:mjuAudio.Flac.Audio.BitStream.ReadUnaryUint
member.summary: Gets the value of the unary coded integer found at the current bit stream position.
member.remarks:
Once the read is complete, the stream points one bit past the end of the integer.
Unary-coded integers are of the following form:
1 = 01
2 = 001
3 = 0001
etc...
member.returns: An unsigned integer.

member.name: M:mjuAudio.Flac.Audio.BitStream.ReadInt32(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a big endian 32-bit signed integer from the bit stream.
member.remarks: The bit stream must be pointing to the first bit in the 32-bit integer.
member.param: The number of bits on which the 32-bit integer is coded. Note that due to the way FLAC encodes integer, this is not necessarily 32, but may be anything between 0 and 32.
member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer read from the stream.

member.name: M:mjuAudio.Flac.Audio.BitStream.ReadUInt32(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a 32-bit unsigned integer from the bit stream.
member.remarks: The bit stream must be pointing to the first bit in the 32-bit integer.
member.param: The number of bits on which the 32-bit integer is coded. Note that due to the way FLAC encodes integer, this is not necessarily 32, but may be anything between 0 and 32. No check is performed on the value of for the sake of performance.
member.returns: A 32-bit unsigned integer read from the bit stream.

member.name: M:mjuAudio.Flac.Audio.BitStream.ReadByte
member.summary: Gets the next 8 bits from the bit stream's current position.
member.returns: The value read from the stream, comprised between 0 and 255 inclusive.

member.name: M:mjuAudio.Flac.Audio.BitStream.ReadBytes(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the next bytes from the bit stream's current position.
member.param: The number of bytes to retrieve. Must be less than or equal to 8. No check is performed on the value of for the sake of performance.
member.returns: A 64-bit unsigned integer containing the bytes read. The last byte read is the least significant byte.

member.summary: Gets or sets the bit position within the current byte. 0 is the left-most bit, 7 the right-most.

member.name: P:mjuAudio.Flac.Audio.BitStream.Position
member.summary: Gets or sets the 0-based offset of the current byte in the stream.
member.remarks: It is not possible to set the position past the end of the stream. Trying to do so results in no change to the position value.

member.name: T:mjuAudio.Flac.Audio.BitStream.BitBuffer
member.summary: Implements an intermediate buffer between the disk file and the FlacNetLib decoder.
member.remarks:
Bit buffers are objects internal to . They should not be used outside of that context. They are documented here for the mere sake of consistency and completeness.
The BitStream class uses two bit buffers, with one (the background buffer) being asynchronously filled in the background, while the other (the current buffer) is being read from. When the latter has been exhausted, the two buffers switch roles: the previous background buffer becomes the new current one, ready to be read from, while the former current buffer becomes the background buffer, and starts refilling if more audio data is available.

member.summary: The actual buffer.

member.name: F:mjuAudio.Flac.Audio.BitStream.BitBuffer.BufferReady
member.summary: Indicates whether the buffer has been properly filled and is ready to be used.

member.name: F:mjuAudio.Flac.Audio.BitStream.BitBuffer.StartOffset
member.summary: Gets the zero-based offset of the start of the BitBuffer, in bytes, relative to the start of the BitStream.

member.name: F:mjuAudio.Flac.Audio.BitStream.BitBuffer.Length
member.summary: Gets the actual number of valid bytes in the buffer.
member.value: This is generally 8K, but may be less in case of an incomplete read (such as when reaching the end of the file).

or must be called before this method can be used, otherwise a may be thrown.

member.name: M:mjuAudio.Flac.FlacFile.WriteChanges
member.summary: Commits changes to the FLAC file.
member.remarks:
The write operation will be cancelled if the event is defined and the handler sets the Cancel property of the related .
If the metadata fits exactly in the space available on disk, only that part will be rewritten for a faster save operation, and the BlockWritten event won't be triggered; if it does not, the whole file gets rewritten, and the BlockWritten event is triggered for every 128KB written.

member.name: M:mjuAudio.Flac.FlacFile.WriteChanges(System.String)
member.summary: Commits changes to another FLAC file, leaving the original file untouched.
member.param: The full path to the target file. If null, the file referenced by this instance of will be overwritten. In this case, an attempt is made to write only the metadata part if it fits in the space available on disk, for a faster write operation.
member.remarks:
The write operation will be cancelled if the event is defined and the handler sets the Cancel property of the related .
If the metadata fits in the space available on disk, only that part will be rewritten for a faster save operation, and the BlockWritten event won't be triggered; if it does not, the whole file gets rewritten, and the BlockWritten event is triggered for every 128KB written.

member.name: M:mjuAudio.Flac.FlacFile.RefreshInfoSet

member.name: M:mjuAudio.Flac.FlacFile.UpdateMetadata(mjuAudio.Flac.Info.InfoSet,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Updates metadata from the content of an .
member.param: The infoSet from which to update the meta data blocks.
The minimum size of the PADDING block to be added at the end of the metadata. Use a negative value for automatic adjustment of the padding (see below). Default value is -1.
true to extend the padding to the next page boundary, false otherwise. Default value is true.
member.remarks: When is set to a negative value, the padding is automatically adjusted: if the new metadata is smaller than the former metadata, a padding size is computed that will make the new metadata (including padding) the same size as the former metadata; if the new metadata is larger than the former metadata, the padding size is set to 0 and the rounding policy then applied as per the value of .

member.name: M:mjuAudio.Flac.FlacFile._setCurrentTrack
member.summary: Sets and according to the value of .

member.name: M:mjuAudio.Flac.FlacFile._adjustPadding(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adjusts padding so that the current metadatafits the space on disk (if smaller), or pad to the next 16K boundary.
member.param: true to round the padding to the next page boundary.

The minimum padding size to be used. If set to a negative value, the padding is automatically adjusted so that the overall metadata area fits in the space available on disk; if the metadata area is larger than the space available on disk, the padding is set to 0 (and the rounding then applied as per the value of .

member.summary: Gets the total space, in bytes, including headers and padding, that the current metadata (including the STREAMINFO block) would take once written to disk.
member.remarks: This may be different from the value returned by , in case the metadata has been modified and the changes have not yet been committed to disk.

member.name: T:mjuAudio.Flac.Info.InfoSet
member.summary: A class abstracting and regrouping various pieces of data from the metadata blocks

member.name: M:mjuAudio.Flac.Info.InfoSet.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.List{mjuAudio.Flac.Metadata.Block},mjuAudio.Flac.FlacFile)
member.summary: Create a new InfoSet from a set of metadata blocks (used when reading from an existing FLAC file)
member.param: A metadata block collection to build the from. Default value is null.
A who's metadata bloc collection is to be used to build the from.

remarks.para:
The is created from the tags found in the and
blocks contained in the primary source metadata block collection (see below for more). If no VorbisComment block is found, a default is derived from the name of the FLAC file passed as parameter (equal to the file's name, stripped of its extension, or to an empty string if is null), and a default is created with a title equal to the default Title, and spanning the entire audio content of the file.
If both and are null, an empty InfoSet is created.
If only one is specified, then it is used as primary source.
If both are specified, is used as primary source, and as source for the default Title and Track values.

member.name: T:mjuAudio.Flac.MD5Engine
member.summary: Implements the MD5 hash algorithm.
member.remarks:
The .NET implementation is not used because it does not allow for on-the-fly data accumulation.
The MD5 algorithm was developped by Pr. Ron Rivest of MIT. The FlacNetLib implementation is inspired from the one provided with the reference libFlac implementation.

member.name: M:mjuAudio.Flac.MD5Engine.#ctor(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Creates a new MD5 computation engine.
member.param: The number of bytes per audio sample. Defaults to 2.
member.remarks: This MD5 implementation only supports samples that consist in an integer number of bytes (e.g., 8 bits, 16bits, 24 bits, etc...).

member.name: M:mjuAudio.Flac.MD5Engine.Accumulate(System.Int32[][])
member.summary: Concatenates data with the previous, and performs a partial MD5 hash computation.
member.param: A 2-dimensional array of audio data. The first index is the channel number, the second one the sample number.

member.name: M:mjuAudio.Flac.MD5Engine.FinalizeHash
member.summary: Finalizes the MD5 hash computation.
member.remarks: See for an example showing FinalizeHash() use.

member.summary: Gets the MD5 hash value, as a byte array.
member.value: Returns null until has been called.

member.summary: Gets the MD5 hash value, as a string.
member.value: Returns null until has been called.

member.name: M:mjuAudio.Flac.Metadata.SeekTable.Create(mjuAudio.Flac.FlacFile,System.Double,System.Func{System.Int32,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Creates a new seek table for a given FLAC file, with regularly spaced seek points.
member.param: The for which to create the seek table.
The interval between seek points, in seconds. Defaults to 10.
A callback function to be called for every seek point created.
member.remarks: This may be a lengthy operation, depending on the size of the FLAC file. The callback allows the calling party to track progress and cancel the operation as necessary. The parameter passed to the callback is the number of seek points added so far. If the callback returns false, the seek table creation is cancelled and null is returned.
member.returns: A new populated , or null if the operation was cancelled.

member.param: The number of the seekpoint to return.

member.summary: Gets the number of total samples in the stream.

'Samples' means inter-channel sample, i.e., one second of 44.1ksamples/s audio will have 44100 samples regardless of the number of channels.
A value of zero here means the number of total samples is unknown.

member.name: T:mjuAudio.Flac.Time
member.summary: Represents a time as a number of minutes, seconds, and frames.

member.name: F:mjuAudio.Flac.Time.FramesPerSecond
member.summary: The number of frames contained in a second.

member.summary: The number of minutes in the canonical representation of the structure

member.name: F:mjuAudio.Flac.Time.Second
member.summary: The number of seconds in the canonical representation of the structure.
member.value: The returned value is always comprised between 0 and 59 inclusive.

member.name: F:mjuAudio.Flac.Time.Frame
member.summary: The number of frames in the canonical representation of the structure.
member.value: The returned value is always comprised between 0 and 74 inclusive.

member.summary: A structure corresponding to time 0.

member.name: M:mjuAudio.Flac.Time.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new Time structure from numbers of minutes, seconds, and frames.
member.param: The number of minutes.
The number of seconds.
The number of frames.
member.remarks: The numbers used for seconds and frames are arbitrary, i.e., they can be greater than 59 or 74 respectively. The Time structure will be "normalized" when created to bring it back to a so-called canonical representation with less than 60 seconds and 75 frames. An example is given below.

member.name: M:mjuAudio.Flac.Time.#ctor(System.Double,mjuAudio.Flac.TimeUnit)
member.summary: Creates a new Time structure of a given duration.
member.param: A duration in a given time unit.
The time unit in which the duration is expressed.

member.name: M:mjuAudio.Flac.Time.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new Time structure from a time string.
member.param: The time string, formatted as "mm:ss:ff" where mm are minutes, ss seconds, and ff frames.
member.exception: This exception is thrown if the format of the time string is incorrect.

member.name: M:mjuAudio.Flac.Time.op_Addition(mjuAudio.Flac.Time,mjuAudio.Flac.Time)
member.summary: Gets the sum of two Times.
member.param: A Time.
Another Time.
member.returns: A Time structure representing the sum of the two Times.

member.name: M:mjuAudio.Flac.Time.op_Subtraction(mjuAudio.Flac.Time,mjuAudio.Flac.Time)
member.summary: Gets the difference between two Times.
member.param: A Time that will be substracted from.
The Time to be substracted from .
member.returns: A Time structure representing the difference between the two Times.

member.name: M:mjuAudio.Flac.Time.op_Equality(mjuAudio.Flac.Time,mjuAudio.Flac.Time)
member.summary: Checks whether two Times are equal.
member.param: The first operand.
The second operand
member.returns: true if the operands represent Times of the same duration, (e.g., 00:01:00 is equal to 00:00:75,) false otherwise.

member.name: M:mjuAudio.Flac.Time.op_Inequality(mjuAudio.Flac.Time,mjuAudio.Flac.Time)

member.param: The first operand.
The second operand.
member.returns: true if the operands represent Times of different durations, false otherwise.

The second operand.
member.returns: true if represents a longer time than , false otherwise.

The second operand.
member.returns: true if represents a Time longer than, or equal to , false otherwise.

member.summary: Compares two Times.

member.returns: true if represents a time shorter than or equal to , false otherwise.

member.summary: Checks whether this instance is equal to a specified object.
member.param: An object to compare with this instance.

member.name: M:mjuAudio.Flac.Time.GetHashCode
member.summary: Gets a hash code for this instance.
member.remarks: The hash code is actually the total number of frames that the Time represents. Hence Times of equal duration have equal hashcodes.
member.returns: A hash code for this instance.

member.name: M:mjuAudio.Flac.Time.ToString
member.summary: Gets the time in "mm:ss:ff" format.
member.returns: The time string "mm:ss:ff" where mm represents a number of minutes, ss a number of seconds, and ff a number of frames.

member.name: M:mjuAudio.Flac.Time.ToFrames
member.summary: Gets the duration of the Time structure in number of frames.
member.returns: The number of frames (always an integer value).
member.remarks: Because the smaller unit that a Time can be expressed in is frames, this method returns an integer value, unlike and .

member.name: M:mjuAudio.Flac.Time.ToSeconds
member.summary: Gets the duration of the Time structure in number of seconds.
member.returns: The number of seconds (a float).
member.remarks: Because the smaller unit that a Time can be expressed in is frames, i.e., a fraction of seconds, this method returns an floating point value.

member.name: M:mjuAudio.Flac.Time.ToMinutes
member.summary: Gets the duration of the Time structure in number of minutes.
member.returns: The number of minutes (a float).
member.remarks: Because the smaller unit that a Time can be expressed in is frames, i.e., a fraction of minutes, this method returns an floating point value.

member.summary: Adds a given number of time units to a Time.

The time unit.
member.returns: The current Time instance.

member.summary: Substracts a given number of time units from a Time.

The time unit.
member.returns: The current Time instance.

member.name: M:mjuAudio.Flac.Time.CompareTo(mjuAudio.Flac.Time)
member.summary: Compares this instance to another Time structure.

member.returns: 0 if both Times are equal, 1 if this instance is of greater duration, -1 if it is smaller.

member.summary: Checks whether this instance is equal to a specified Time.

member.name: M:mjuAudio.Flac.Utils.BigEndianConv.ToByteArray(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Converts a 32-bit unsigned integer to a 4-byte big-endian array (MSB at index 0).
member.param: The 32-bit unsigned integer to be converted to a byte array.
member.returns: A 4-byte array containing the big endian representation of .

member.name: M:mjuAudio.Flac.Utils.BigEndianConv.ToByteArray(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts a 32-bit signed integer to a 4-byte big-endian array (MSB at index 0).
member.param: The 32-bit signed integer to be converted to a byte array.
member.returns: A 4-byte array containing the big endian representation of .

member.name: M:mjuAudio.Flac.Utils.BigEndianConv.ToByteArray(System.Int16)
member.summary: Converts a 16-bit signed integer to a 2-byte big-endian array (MSB at index 0).
member.param: The 16-bit signed integer to be converted to a byte array.
member.returns: A 2-byte array containing the big endian representation of .

member.name: M:mjuAudio.Flac.Utils.BigEndianConv.ToInt32(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts 4 consecutive bytes of a byte array to a 32-bit signed integer, in big endian notation.
member.param: The byte array where to fetch the bytes to be converted.
The index of the first, i.e. most significant, byte.
member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer represented by [] through [+3] in big endian notation.

member.name: M:mjuAudio.Flac.Utils.CrcCalc.#ctor(System.Int32,System.UInt64,System.UInt64,System.UInt64,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a Crc computation engine for any CRC of order between 1 and 32.
member.param: The CRC polynom order, between 1 and 32.
The CRC polynom, excluding the high order coefficient.
The init value for the algorithm.
The final XOR value..
If true, the order of the input bits will be reflected before processing
If true, the CRC will be reflected before the final XOR.

member.name: M:mjuAudio.Flac.Utils.CrcCalc.#ctor(mjuAudio.Flac.Utils.CrcType)
member.summary: Create a CRC computation engine for predefined CRC types.
member.param: The CRC type.

members.member: Fast lookup table algorithm without augmented zero bytes. Only usable with polynom orders of 8, 16, 24 or 32. . The Byte array to compute the CRC on. The CRC value.

member.name: M:mjuAudio.Flac.Utils.CrcCalc.BitByBitCrc(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Fast bit by bit algorithm without augmented zero bytes. Does not use a lookup table, suiteable for any polynom order between 1 and 32.
member.param: The Byte array to compute the CRC on.
member.returns: The CRC value.
